body: @mikmikus are you able to provide a minimal example or is your project open source?

> [@MikMikus](https://github.com/MikMikus) are you able to provide a minimal example or is your project open source?

https://github.com/MikMikus/bevy_text_problem_example
I hope this will be helpful.

After migrating my main app, i wasn't sure how much of the performance loss was my fault and how much was due to changes in the engine.

Now, for raw example i don't notice any differences between Text2d and Text2d with Text Spawn.
But that's something new I noticed. Text2d with Visibility::Hidden does not improve performance.

For example from above  i have:

| |multi sections text    | one section text  | text with Visibility:Hidden | None |
| -------- | ------- | ------- | ------- | ------- |
| bevy 13  | ~17 fps   | ~17 fps | ~70 fps | ~70 fps |
| bevy 14  | ~17.5 fps   | ~17.5 fps | ~65 fps | ~67 fps |
| bevy 15     |  ~8 fps   | ~8 fps | ~7 fps (!) | ~50 fps |

My PC: Intel i5-11500, GeForce RTX 3070, 6.11.2-4-MANJARO.

issue.body:
# Objective

Probably fixes #16972

## Solution

With 100k text2d, tracy was showing most time being spent in `extract_components<bevy_sprite::SpriteSource>`.

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e82d5d4e-bb39-4d7e-ab7f-47a5466cb74f)

Browsing Bevy's code, this `SpriteSource` component is seemingly not even used in the render world. So I just ~~deleted the code that was extracting it~~ it.

## Testing

`cargo run --example text2d` still seems to work.

The example from [my comment](https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/issues/16972#issuecomment-2562680876) in the linked issue shows a ~50x speedup.

Make it easier to test for `Text2d` performance regressions.

Related to #16972

```bash

cargo run --release --example many_text2d
cargo run --release --example many_text2d -- --many_glyphs
```

@rparrett  Your pull request fixed the text hiding issue nicely.

> Unfortunately, the main optimization from [#16991](https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/pull/16991) can't be backported to 0.15, and I'm not really sure how to achieve something similar there.

To work around this problem in my main app, instead of using Hide/Visible directly on the text, I check the parent and dynamically spawn/despawn child text when parent is visible or not.

I am concerned about the performance drop for texts between version 13/14 and 15, because it hits my application hard. Maybe it is not a direct problem of the Tex2d component.

I am also not sure how much my code is suboptimal. For example, in my application I have a performance difference between Tex2d only and Tex2d with TextSpan, but in the synthetic example I could not reproduce such a dependency.

Unfortunately I do not know the bevy core well enough to help. But if I find any text-performance dependency that can be reproduced I will report it.

Thanks for your time!

Thanks!

> 165 is the refresh rate limit of my monitor

You can [disable vsync](https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/commit/ad9f946201546ba85b90e521241916c85784c2b9#diff-d44869051cf659cc0e8373167d0f19a4493268ee8d1a0f659894376e3181bfb7R70) like we do in the in-repo stress tests.

> Maybe it is not a direct problem of the Tex2d component

I suspect you're right -- I am seeing a performance drop in `bevymark` as well, so sprite performance (text2d are sprites when rendered) in general seems to be an issue.

main: ~46fps
0.15: ~40fps
0.14: ~76fps

> Tex2d only and Tex2d with TextSpan

I would expect/understand a difference in 0.15 related to this especially for *dynamic text*, because we now have to navigate a hierarchy to build/rebuild the underlying text layout buffer.

But I could also see this being the case to a lesser extent for static text. Hm.

The UI text rendering has some optimisations I didn't have time to port to text2d for 0.15, which is why text rendering is so much slower in text2d than the UI. I'll have a go today, should be able to get a 5x to 10x ish improvement easily.
